meanings.definition: The status of being a citizen.
meanings.sent1: Her citizenships in two countries allow her to travel freely between them.
meanings.sent2: The government granted him citizenships after he passed the required tests.
meanings.sent3: His citizenships were proudly displayed on his passport.
meanings.sent4: The citizenships of the students shone brightly during the national anthem.
meanings.sent5: The value of citizenships cannot be underestimated in a global world.

meanings.definition: The rights and duties of a citizen.
meanings.sent1: Respecting the laws is one of the key citizenships every person should uphold.
meanings.sent2: Citizenships come with responsibilities as well as privileges.
meanings.sent3: He took his citizenships seriously, always voting in elections.
meanings.sent4: The citizenships of the residents were evident in their active participation in community events.
meanings.sent5: Understanding your citizenships is essential for being a responsible member of society.

meanings.definition: The character of an individual viewed as a member of society.
meanings.sent1: Her friendly nature and helpful attitude reflect her good citizenships.
meanings.sent2: Good citizenships involve being kind and considerate towards others.
meanings.sent3: His citizenships shone through when he volunteered to help the elderly.
meanings.sent4: The citizenships of the students were evident in their teamwork during the project.
meanings.sent5: The importance of teaching positive citizenships to children cannot be overstated.
